identificationModule.briefTitle: ICF in Secondary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Use of ICF Classification System in Secondary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease Among Others Ischemic and Hemorrhagic Stroke.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study was to develop a practical protocol based on the ICF(The International Classification of Functioning, Disability, and Health) the risk factors of cardiovascular disease (CVD) in secondary prevention.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The original ICF assessment sheet contains CVD risk factor categories, such as comorbidities (depressive disorders, insomnia, heart rhythm and heart rate disorders, carotid artery disease, and hypertension), measures of liver and renal impairment, disorders of carbohydrate and lipid metabolism). The evaluation criteria for each category were determined based on recommendations defined in the ESC, AHA, EFSD, and KIDIGO guidelines.

armGroups.label: Patients after ischemic stroke
armGroups.description: The analysis included the presence of CVD risk factors in patients after ischemic stroke durning in the early rehabilitation.

armGroups.label: Patients after hemorrhagic stroke
armGroups.description: The analysis included the presence of CVD risk factors in patients after hemorrhagic stroke durning in the early rehabilitation.

primaryOutcomes.description: heart rhythm interpreting ECG (regular or irregular)

primaryOutcomes.measure: functions related to the coagulation of blood.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* the first episode of ischemic stroke or hemorrhagic stroke,
* full medical documentation with a description of the above-mentioned risk factors

Exclusion Criteria:

* another neurological disease: brain tumor, trauma craniocerebral
* incomplete medical history - no data on assessed risk factors CVD
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: 60 patients after ischemic stroke 60 patients after hemorrhagic stroke
